message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SD

The paper proposes a method for discriminative representation learning using a restricted Boltzmann machine (RBM) with class information preservation constraints. This falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) and computer vision (cs.CV) as it involves learning representations for classification tasks. The use of RBMs also suggests the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Additionally, the paper mentions experimental results, indicating the use of neural networks, which falls under the category of neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE). Finally, the paper mentions preserving global data locality, which suggests the category of software engineering (cs.SD) as it involves designing and implementing algorithms for efficient data processing.
